item.title: Ubuntu freezes when connecting!
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
This sound like a RAM issue. Do you have sufficient RAM for both Whonix and your host running at the same time? Try shutting down any unnecessary processes on your host.

You can also use rads to decrease the RAM in Whonix-Gateway to the minimum necessary for the desktop to start: 512 MB

Whonix

RAM Adjusted Desktop Starter

rads - Starts [no] desktop environment based on available RAM. Automatically boots into graphical desktop environment, when there is enough RAM. Or in...

You may also have to lower RAM in VirtualBox. These instructions show where to do that. (Make sure to lower not increase RAM)

askubuntu.com
